question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to make the code executable for demonstration purposes. Please use Taro to quickly develop a WeChat Mini Program that can recognize Code 128 barcodes.

checklist.title: Is the Taro environment configured correctly?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes proper Taro initialization, with correct dependencies (Taro core, React/Vue binding, WeChat Mini Program adapters) and configuration files (project.config.json, app.config.ts). Verify that the project structure follows Taro conventions and includes appropriate build scripts. Deduct 5 points if essential dependencies are missing, 3 points if configurations are incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Code 128 barcode recognition algorithm implemented correctly?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of the Code 128 barcode decoding algorithm: check for proper handling of start/stop characters, checksum validation, and character set switching (Code 128A/B/C). The implementation should handle different barcode densities and have appropriate error correction. Score 10 points for a complete implementation with all Code 128 features, 5 points for basic recognition without full feature support, and 0 points if the core algorithm is missing or fundamentally flawed.

checklist.title: Is the camera access functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code correctly utilizes Taro's camera component or WeChat's camera API to access the device camera. Check for proper permission handling, preview frame rendering, and frame capturing for barcode processing. The implementation should include focus control, flash control options, and proper camera resolution settings for barcode scanning. Deduct 5 points if camera permissions aren't properly handled, 3 points if preview quality is poor. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the image processing pipeline efficient for barcode detection?
checklist.description: Analyze the image processing approach: check for preprocessing steps (grayscale conversion, binarization, noise reduction), barcode localization algorithms, and optimization techniques. The implementation should handle various lighting conditions and scan angles. Evaluate processing speed and memory efficiency. Score 10 points for a comprehensive pipeline with optimizations, 5 points for basic functionality that works only in ideal conditions, and 0 points if critical processing steps are missing.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as camera permission denial, poor lighting conditions, partial or damaged barcodes, processing timeout) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Batch scanning capability 2. History of scanned codes 3. Scanning statistics and analytics 4. Augmented reality overlay for scan guidance). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant image processing steps that slow down scanning 2. Function modules unrelated to barcode scanning (e.g., unnecessary social sharing features) 3. Heavy visual effects that affect scanning performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating camera handling/image processing/UI layers), unit test coverage for algorithm components, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern WeChat Mini Program design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Scan feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual scan guidance and feedback. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy camera preview during scanning, and 5 points for confusing user interface during the scanning process. The full score is 10 points.
